answers.answer: It would be best to get yourself checked out. Go to the doctor or ER ASAP. It could be PIH. I had these symptoms near the end of my pregnancy, I ended up being induced and my daughter was born via c-section. Good luck to you and keep us posted!
Thanks I go to the doctor at 11:30 so I will keep you posted. Thank you

ok, i felt the same way during my first pregnancy and this current one. nothing was wrong. that book scares you alot and everytime i felt something weird in my life, i searched it online. i now know that searching is not only a waste of time, but a really wrong way to get info . the best way is talk to your doctor. my doctor says that you need to have medical background and be a doctor to really understand and know the searches online. otherwise, youre getting info that more than likely has nothing to do with you.
sounds like it may be preeclampsia. let us know what they say. good luck.

Well I had my doctors appointment and my blood pressure was normal, but if I continue to have the severe headaches then he wants me to call him. He said I am just getting close and having alot of pains. I am so ready to have this little man. Thanks for all the posts and support.

question: I have been doing a lot of research for the past few hours and i am concerned about what I am finding. I am now 30 weeks and for the past few days (since Thursday) I have had severe headaches, pain in my upper abdomen, I have been feeling like my heart is going to jump out of my chest and sleeping alot more than normal. My face and hands have also been getting more swolen. I was looking through my What to Expect when your Expecting and online and have got the same response. Pregnancy Induced Hypertynsion. I do have a doctors appointment tomorrow but I am so scared that I cant sleep. Could this be something else....... HELP
title: Sorry for all the posts but maybe it is something...
